result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam G Sellers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
01/15/16. COURT GRANTS 14 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF REVOKED.

miscConds.notes: Restitution total of $1,220.00 is as follows: $60.00 for Service of Process fee, $300.00 (repair door) $860.00 in medical bills. To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with victims or their residence.
Attend Anger Management classes.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - (w-huber) Standard release. Last 25 days STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.

with three exhibits attached.  Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
three exhibits - Exh. 1 - Restitution Summary, Exh. 2 & 3 - Photo

Defendant Adam G Sellers in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing and restitution hearing. Parties proceed to sentencing. Parties proceed to restitution hearing. Michael Diliberto sworn and testified. Exhibit S1, S2 and S3 marked, offered and received. State rests. Defense rests. Testimony is closed. State argues. Defense argues. Court sets restitution at $300 for door, $60 for process fee and $860.00 for medical bills totaling $1220.00. 


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 7 months jail straight time STAYED for 1 year Probation
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $60.00 for Service of Process fee for Temporary Restraining Order stipulated, $300.00 to repair door, $860.00 for medical bills for a total of $1220.00 and to be paid as a Condition of Probation. 
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with the victims or their residence.  Anger Management. Mental Health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.  
- 45 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 08/07/2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release Conditions. Last 25 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Restitution hearing on August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
